job_title: Sterile Processing Technician in Nashville, TN
pros: Good pay, good moral, great management
cons: Poor work life balance, numbers driven

job_title: Clinical Review Coordinator in Nashville, TN
pros: Fulfilling Mission Team atmosphere Flexibility
cons: Salary not competitive when compared to position requirements.

pros: Teammates actually care for one another and the mission is the priority.
cons: Processes could be streamlined to gain efficiency.

job_title: Sterile Processing Technician in Nashville, TN
pros: None that I can think of.
cons: It's a toxic environment throughout. Training is poor. When you do learn what to do, they will take advantage of you and make you work as much as possible while they sit on their butts and not help you. Sometimes working through lunch and bathroom breaks. They also clock you out while you work during your lunch, which is illegal. The racist supervisors will throw you under the bus and lie in order to get you fired especially if you are a minority. Also, there have been cases of sexual harassment with little repercussions . The pay is not worth the work that you put in. Also, you think it's a good company to work for because of their "mission" but in actually the way that they harass patient's families and the nurses who took care of those individuals in order to procure their bodies is disgusting. I would stay away from this company which is full of lies and deceptions.

pros: The mission and culture of the company is unmatched. The benefits are good as well as PTO/sick time is plentiful.
cons: The department I'm in the director is power crazy and unorganized. She gives the company a bad name.

pros: Overall a job with a lot of autonomy. Great coworkers. Impactful mission.
cons: There were severe issues with upper management when I was employed there. Also not a lot of room for advancement outside of the clinical on call staff.

pros: The pay was nice but everything else was pretty much awful.
cons: There is so much wrong. Might as well sit at your desk and shut your mouth. The upper management is trash, the people will stab you in the back to get ahead. There is just nothing good going for them

job_title: Quality Compliance Manager in Nashville, TN
pros: Good cause that has helped many people.
cons: No security in job . Antagonistic environment

review_title: Don’t walk. RUN. RUN FAR AWAY.
job_title: Tissue Processing Technician in Nashville, TN
pros: The mission is cool. It would be cooler if they actually stood by it.
cons:
Everything outside of the mission and the few decent humans still there. Management is a complete joke. Divisiveness between team members is encouraged by leadership to distract from the countless management disasters and ways they are taking advantage of employees. Meanwhile those at the top pat themselves on the back and afford themselves hefty salaries while necessary repairs, supplies, and equipment for safe and proper processing of tissue are put on the back burner indefinitely. 

Hard work is never recognized, while favoritism is highly prevalent and based solely on personal relationships between leadership and subordinates. 

This place will bleed you dry. Don’t work here.

pros: Very meaningful work. Professional atmosphere.
cons: Wish there was clearer communication from leadership.

review_title: great mission but management misses the mark
pros: Hardworking, devoted coworkers who are great at their job. Mission of saving lives.
cons: Top heavy management who are out of touch with staff. Questionable ethics. Extremely long hours to the point of being dangerous, low pay for what is demanded of staff, impossible to have any work life balance.

job_title: Hospital Services Representative in Albuquerque, NM
pros: The companies mission statement which unfortunately management doesn’t adhere to.
cons: Badly run, employees mistreated. Management is only concerned with using company money for travel & entertainment. Devious, can’t trust what your told.

review_title: Company mission and goals are great the management not really
pros: save lives and everyone is a major part of that and the experience is awesome
cons:
It doesn't matter how hard you work, how much of your time you give it is never enough, you are never good enough, and nothing you do until you either quit or loose your mind and break. DONT quit a good job for this one, Non profits are inherently riddled with office drama/politics/ and otherwise mistreatment of employees but this one is just beyond frustrating. You really DONT matter to your boss unless you are working your hardest and even then, its just not good enough. I am not a disgruntled ex employee I am just writing a real review on a company I wish I would have read prior to leaving my former job. If you are questioning it at this point, listen to your gut. There is no work life balance here. 
They give you great PTO then make you use it to "pay" for holiday that you have no choice but to take. You are told that you should not be going to doctors if it interferes with your work times and they are very inflexible about accommodating schedules. ALSO good luck getting out of work on time or being felt like you have been guilt tripped into working overtime. They expect work to come first before family, and there is no monetary price for having a good work life balance and a company who RESPECTS that.

pros: Good people who work there
cons: low pay and bad management

pros: The other DC's were really lovely to work with. There were some wonderful people there. The benefits package was decent, and the pay was comparable to wages at other OPO's.
cons: Management is not transparent and the daily dealings of the company seem very fractured and disjointed. The employees are not treated with respect or consideration. Often someone working the night before (7pm-7am) is expected to attend a meeting the next day from 10am-2pm without the option of teleconferencing. There is very little room for upward growth in the Communications Center. Well-trained, competent and experienced DC's who are qualified for managerial positions are not afforded the opportunity to grow in the company and the executive team instead opts to externally hire new managers. As a result of poor hiring practices and a stressful, demoralizing environment at work, DCI has gone through several Communications Center managers in the last three years. The Communications Center is understaffed and the staff are overworked. I would not recommend anyone work in the Communications Center of this company, and considering the way DCI treats these employees, I would recommend steering clear of this company.

pros: The mission and only the mission
cons: Bad management, divisions pitted against each other, constant fear-mongering by management

pros: The people who work here are some of the most selfless, caring people I have ever met.  They truly are there for the right reasons; to help as many people as possible  through organ and tissue donation.  It's too bad they have to do it with one hand tied behind their backs.
cons:
Executive management.  These people are making decisions about how things should be done in departments that they are not familiar with, and they are ruining the company.  They refuse to listen to those who actually have knowledge and experience, instead they will fire those who disagree or are not 100% in agreement.  Hence the very high turnover rate (60% in some departments), which is then blamed on department managers. 

The biggest shame of all, is how donor families are led to believe that they are doing something wonderful and that their loved one's gift is helping a person in need.  When in actuality, if it is not an organ donation, executive management does not care.  Tissue donors (and their families) are not important, and there is no effort made to ensure that once a family consents to donation that the gift is honored.  Their only concern is to appease funeral homes, coroners, and hospital staff.  Donor families are not a priority.

review_title: Poorly run company. Benefits are ok.
pros: Benefits (vision, dental, health, life ins, retirement) are ok. Pay is ok but not good. Parking included. You get some computer training.
cons: Horrible place to work. Management is just the worst and all of them are so arrogant. The staff is treated horribly. The workers gets treated badly and also gets blacklisted and sometimes fired it they go talk to a manager about some problem there. I've never worked any where where the people are treated like total idiots and always talked down to The managers doesn't follow the policy rules but they reprimand or they even fire the staff for not following the rules  Almost everybody probably except for the managers is looking for a new job. Discrimination is big here too.  I heard a few years ago DCI was a pretty good place to work but then the managmenet changed and now its awful.  But also the products here are pretty bad to. It’s a paycheck.

pros: Great purpose, consistently growing, new location coming soon
cons: Growing pains, needs better communication,

pros: Helping others through their grief by sharing with those in need.
cons: This is the worst employer Ive ever worked for.  Bad management from the CEO Jill Grandas on down.  It was a horrible experience and Ive had to have counseling due to PTSD from the constant threats of losing my job.  Expectations are unrealistic and the most unethical of any place I have ever worked.  Having to contact families within an hour of the death of their loved one (threats of job loss),  shows no compassion and is an intrusion to a very private time.  Jobs are threatened if this is not done and its all to make funeral homes happy.  I understand that time is of the essence, however the families who share the gift of life should be shown respect and given the utmost care, not pushed to make a decision to make a funeral home happy.  The funeral professionals are trained to deal with the results of donation and so forth.   The families are the last to be considered as this is all about money now and not about caring.  I chose to leave the company and it was the best decision I have ever made.

pros: The missions and value of the company is to Save and Enhance Lives, if you care about the well being of others and doing work that truly makes a difference then this will pull on your heart strings
cons:
No work-life balance, and although the companies missions and value is to Save and Enhance Lives this was the first company I worked for who did not have a company value regarding employees. Some may feel it is unnecessary to have and is common human nature to put your employees first, even above customers and the mission statement, but I feel when you do this, it takes care of everything else.  

Without having the companies intention voiced in the mission and value statement speaks to why upper management feel they can talk to you in unpleasant manners and expect you not to speak your mind and voice your opinion. If you do you are black balled and considered a non-team player.  Environment then becomes hostile and provokes poor performance and creates the paper trail they desire to terminations.  High turnover you would think HR would figure out its upper management but they use paper trails to cover themselves and know how to work the system in their favor.

review_title: Honorable mission, other than honorable values in some of the top positions.
pros: There are mostly excellent, honest people there working hard daily.  Unique and challenging vocation.  Salaries are decent to good; great benefits package.
cons: Home/work life balance can get out of balance often.  See the review title; plenty of other examples posted, no need to pile on.

review_title: Tissue Bank is a Hostile Work Environment caused by Senior Management including the HR Department.
pros: Health benefits & a paycheck: That’s it! If you get interviewed ask about the employee turnover rate. They can’t deny it especially for employees who worked here for 5-10 years or longer. It’s sad & unbelievable! There are so many wonderful people who left due to this management team that otherwise would’ve retired from here.
cons: Hard working employees are not appreciated! The mission is portrayed to be the gift of donation is used to save & enhance lives. The true mission being carried out is to slave drive the employees to enhance management’s pockets. Heaven forbid you make a mistake, have any questions or make any positive suggestions that go against the negative grain. You will be treated like a child until you take a stand and leave this deranged atmosphere. I left after 20 years!

job_title: Organ Recovery Coordinator in Sacramento, CA
pros:
The people are honest and open about the companies situations. The company is in a growth phase and there are opportunities to grow. If you can find a task that needs done you are free to jump in and get it done. Senior staff are supportive and understand mistakes will be made but they work hard to make sure they do not reoccur. 

This organization is like a family who saves lives. There are issues but everyone understands why we are here.
cons: The company needs to fully staff. The schedule needs help. There are too many duties to have so many call days. There is a retention problem. Good people come but then they go.

pros: Great benefits. Great and fun work environment amongst techs!
cons: Racist. Love to hire incompetent people that won’t question them. Hate confident employees. Upper management SUCKS! If you have a degree a target is on your back. Give raises and take them back!

pros: Rewarding feeling with helping those in need of organ transplantation.
cons:
Extremely poor training program.

The Executive Director will slice you right out from underneath your feet. She cares for no one but herself and her own motivations. 

Extremely high turnover. Either people aren’t as quick to learn the job so they nixed or they realize, themselves, that the organization is a train wreck and leave on their own accord. Either way, it’s a waste of your time and theirs to imagine making a lifelong career with them.

The money you THINK you’re donating to “organ procurement” isn’t going to saving lives. It’s going to pay the CEO’s salary, the Executive Director’s salary, and to buy amenities such as a new Keurig machine for the office break room. 

I saw it for myself. This organization is vile. Awful people to work with who are burned out and lack integrity. I’m so glad I left when I did.

review_title: Good Place To Build A Career
pros: I’ve been with the organization for about four years and have seen a lot of growth and change - all for the positive.  I’ve been able to advance my career while helping save the lives of others.  In the last two years, I’ve seen more of a focus on rewarding and recognizing employees - and I think that’s gone a long way for some of us long- term employees.  It’s very easy to get behind the mission of the company.
cons: The company is always in a constant state of change and developing better ways to manage itself, and that can be hard.  Sometimes there can be a lot of bureaucracy.

review_title: Great Company with a great mission
pros: I love working for an organization that strives everyday to be the best. I have never worked with such motivated and hard working people! Everyone has a common goal and that is to save lives. I work in an administrative role, so the hours are fine. The location is great, being right downtown, I am close to everything. I really get along with my manager and everyone in the office. Great group of people to work with!
cons: Sometimes driving into downtown every day gets a little old.

pros: Awesome environment! The people that you work for make all the difference! Also, the people you serve, the families, impact your job everyday. I loved working here and would continue if not for moving to a different state. The company has great health benefits.
cons:
The Bridge2Life center is open 24-7-365 and that can be hard at first when working the night shift, but it's typical for a health related job. 
The hiring process, interviewing, took a while. I believe I had 4-5 interviews. Granted, DCIDS did not have much turnover and I'm assuming because they are very thorough from the beginning.

pros:
Fantastic Health/dental/vision benefits
There are some good people there.
cons: Extremely high stress, zero work/life balance, long hours, super political, and poor upper management.

pros: Fantastic group of people, cohesive team. Love the mission and the core values. Really care about both the recipients and the donor families who make donation possible.
cons: Biggest issue has to do with healthcare benifits. This year my wife was forced off the group health plan because she can get coverage from her part-time job at the school district. That is costing our family $3500 per year above what it was costing us to cover her through DCI. That hurt. They say it is due to ObamaCare.

pros: None.  It’s all a farce.  It’s all about money for the top tier of “management” and taking fancy trips and living lavish lifestyles.
cons: Recently viewed a video of one of the “leaders” on YouTube .   Wow!  So fake.  That’s not really her.  She’s a backstabbing snake.  She gave some fake sob story about donation.   She could care less about donors, donor families and those awaiting transplant.  She’s all about lining her pockets, getting ahead, Botox and her next plastic surgery.

pros: Could be a job that gives personal satisfaction if it wasn’t all about the money.
cons:
The way to advance in this company is to be very social, agree with leadership on everything, never voice your own opinion, never make a decision without asking your supervisor and sing your own praises in every meeting. 
The idea of donation is noble for most however this company has perverted the act into a money making scheme and use the same strong arm tactics as the worst telemarketers only minutes after a death.

review_title: Be careful!!! They will lure you in with the mission and the culture/leadership will break you.
pros: Benefits, non-management employees are great people who care about each other.
cons: Senior leadership. Executive directors and senior leaders who have no working knowledge of what's going on insist their ideas are the only ones that matter,  Don't expect to be heard or given much freedom to make your job your own. It's the money over the mission, don't believe anything else they tell you.

pros: You are helping someone possibly live a better life.
cons: No diversity in management.  If you don't suck up to management you will never get promoted. HR is in cahoots with supervisors and upper management.  Training does not exist. You are shown what to do by various people and they all process differently.  No one follows the SOP's.  Employees that are qualified for positions get looked over because of their race or sexual orientation.  They will find a way to keep you from getting promoted from bogus write ups to out right lies.

pros:
I thought a pro would be that we are "saving and enhancing lives." For me personally, after seeing the recovery (donation) process, I completely disagree. The way the treat the bodies is quite similar to a slaughter house. It's quite disturbing and I definitely do not want that done to me once I pass. 

They're also stuck in 80s technology. So if you like stacks and stacks of paperwork everywhere because they don't have an electronic system yet, then this is the place for you!
cons: I definitely would NOT RECOMMEND working for this company. On my first day, I was told to read over 100 "SOP's" which was my so-called training. How can they expect anyone to read that many SOP's and understand wtf is going on? I felt VERY out of place my first day because no one even acknowledged my presence or tried to welcome me to the team (or should I say clique.) This company literally drained my soul. I would come home sad/pissed off/ miserable EVERY day. Why? The work I did was incredibly draining and depressing. Also, 99% of the employees I worked with were some of the most negative and miserable people I've ever met. Working in that kind of environment truly put a damper on my personality and even my social life. I feel like every time I walked out of the room, people were either talking badly about me or badly about other employees. I'm sorry, but I don't have time for that crap. There is SO much unnecessary drama in that place its unreal. It's worst than high school.  I would say it's as close to hell as you can get.

pros:
-Helping to promote organ & tissue donation can be extremely rewarding.
-The opportunity to provide some small comfort and hope to grieving families is indescribable.
-You can thoroughly be proud of the work that you do & know that you are truly making a difference.
cons:
-Management is often aloof to the processes and needs of the department & does not accept constructive criticism.
-Management lacks transparency; large decisions which will have an effect on employees are often made on impulse.
-Extremely understaffed with very little care or concern from management, resulting in over-worked, bitter, and resentful staff.
-No room for growth opportunities.

job_title: Quality Assurance Analyst in Nashville, TN
pros: Best part of working here is the mission and your co workers. There are some amazing individuals who work here and want to make a difference during a difficult time in someones life.
cons: Prior reviews are spot on with management and the overall culture of this organization. The cliques and drama in the organization are so unprofessional. There are so many individuals in management and director positions that do not belong in them. There is really no room for growth in this company as favoritism runs rampant and those are the people who are able to move up to management positions, whether they are qualified or not. The CEO is really only seen in "All Staff" meetings held monthly in which she acts very condescending towards staff and is only concerned with the donor numbers no matter how they are achieved. Upper management runs the organization letting employees know that they have no problem firing people, one director even going as far as telling her department she "enjoys" it. They will fire multiple employees and leave departments short staffed for months and expect the remaining employees to pick up the extra workload.  They have recruited people who were currently employed and left their job to work here just to fire them 3 weeks later stating they were "not a good fit". If you are looking to work here I would read through the reviews as they are all very spot on and not just disgruntled employees. They do ask current employees to go on and leave good reviews to try and boost their ratings.

job_title: Senior Quality Coordinator in Albuquerque, NM
pros: I am so happy that I found DCIDS!  I work at the NMDS location, and my experiences with management and fellow staff members have been so welcoming and supportive.  There is a great team atmoshpere within our organization.  The people here are truly dedicated to their mission of saving and enhancing lives.
cons: I have nothing bad to say about this organization.

review_title: Overall a Good Place to Work
pros: Great benefits.  Great mission.  My coworkers are passionate about what they do and are great to work with.
cons: Directors and upper management are out of touch with what is really going on and how things work in the company

job_title: Processing Technician I in Nashville, TN
pros: The work that is done there is very beneficial to so many lives!
cons: They do not like outsiders who ask questions. They are having major growing pains, the business is wanting to grow by leaps and bounds but they are way behind the curve.

review_title: if you want to keep your health and family, do not work here
pros: All the over time you could ever want
cons: Mandatory over time up to 16 hours a day,7 days a week. They do not tell you this when you start. Manager and Supervisor pit employees against each other.Very hostile work environment. Supervisor and Manager share personal information about employees they personally do not favor to gain trust with new employees.

pros: Saving and enhancing lives through organ and tissue donation.
cons: CEO and upper management are unprofessional and only concerned about the bottom line, not the mission.  Employees are not compensated or valued nor treated with  respect. Employees input and suggestions fall on deaf ears.

pros: I just started working with the company a few months ago, and what I really like is the family atmosphere.  I feel like I'm part of a mission working toward helping people live better lives.
cons: Sometimes the hours can be long.

pros: It is a job with pay and benefits. I would recommend that anyone looking for a steady employment look elsewhere.
cons: Very bad managers and supervisors. The worst company I have ever worked. Management extremely clicky, unfair, and will lie to your face while smiling at the same time.

review_title: If it were not for the amazing mission, no one in their right mind would work for this train wreck of a company.
job_title: Donor Family Advocate in Nashville, TN
pros: Saving lives through organ and tissue donation.
cons: This entire organization is broken from the top down. Leadership is duplicitous, management is incompetent and HR is just immoral.

pros: Great company with a great mission.  Every employee really "lives" the company mission of saving and enhancing lives.  Employees feel valued and appreciated.
cons: Long hours.  Pay is a little lower than national average.

pros: The staff who believed the mission statement & continue to do the right thing to promote donation
cons: Corrupt management starting with CEO & Directors.

review_title: DCI Donors Services is not a bad company to work for in general.
pros: The ability to move up and move departments. Fun outings. Great people.
cons: Communication is poor. Managment not all on same page.

review_title: Loved the job...but not the politics
job_title: Family Care Coordinator in Nashville, TN
pros: Help save lives and advocate for the community
cons: Not for social beings.  You will get burned.

pros:
Family Friendly.
Engaging with future career goals.
A true team work environment.
Laid back.
cons: The location in downtown Nashville is the worst, due to no fault of their own.

pros: Great environment and team to work around. Incredible opportunities for growth. Very well run organization.
cons: Tough industry but it helps you grow so much.

pros: Great company with great benefits. Very engaging and lots of employee departmental events.
cons: No Cons - great place to work.

review_title: Good work environment, and good people
pros: Good work environment, and good people
cons: Tissue has lots of people coming and going

pros: None! Run while you can.. they will loop you in and then drop you when you least expect it, don't take the job and hope you can stay there.
cons: The whole place. They tell you anything just to keep you in the dark regardless of how bad you depend on the job.

pros: Great Company to work for.
cons: Nothing can be listed.

job_title: Tissue Processing Technician in Nashville, NC
pros:
Great hours
location downtown 
great experience
cons:
A lot of drama
People can be rude at times

pros: Good mission and saving lives is nice.
cons: Little room for advancements in the quality department.

pros: good pay; good benefits; fun environment
cons: long hours; management hard to contact

pros: crazy leadership who's make poor decision
cons: working for dci is horrible
